story.description:
Implement HAIAMM Threat Assessment (TA) practice at Level 1 maturity.

## Practice Overview

**Function:** Building
**Purpose:** Identify and prioritize AI-specific threats

## Level 1 Objectives

Establish basic AI threat awareness and initial threat identification.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] AI-specific threats identified
  - Prompt injection attacks documented
  - Data poisoning risks assessed
  - Model theft/extraction considered
  - Agent misuse scenarios listed

- [ ] Threats mapped to AI systems
  - Vulnerability matrix created
  - Impact assessment completed
  - Priority ranking established

- [ ] Threat actors identified
  - External attackers profiled
  - Insider threats considered
  - Automated attack vectors documented

- [ ] Basic threat model created
  - At least one critical system modeled
  - Data flows documented
  - Trust boundaries identified
  - Threats enumerated

## Definition of Done

- [ ] All acceptance criteria met
- [ ] Threat model documented
- [ ] Stakeholders briefed on top threats
- [ ] Mitigation priorities established

## OWASP Risks Addressed

- ASI01: Agent Goal Hijack
- ASI04: Agentic Supply Chain
- ASI10: Rogue Agents
- LLM04: Data and Model Poisoning

## Resources

- [TA Practice Guide](https://github.com/R3v3rzk1mur4/HAIAMM/docs/practices/TA-Software-OnePager.md)
- [OWASP Top 10 Agentic Risks](https://github.com/R3v3rzk1mur4/HAIAMM/docs/handbook/04-TOP10-AGENTIC-RISKS.md)

## Verifhai Integration

Use `/verifhai-practice TA` for guided threat assessment assistance.

subtasks.description: Identify and document relevant AI threats (injection, poisoning, theft, misuse).
Create vulnerability matrix mapping threats to systems with impact assessment.
Document potential attackers and attack vectors.
Develop threat model for most critical AI system.
